intro: Engelhardia serrata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved engelhardia, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
